Featured Pinoy Dishes

Filipino Style
Chicken Adobo

See complete recipe

chef_hat

FILIPINO STYLE CHICKEN ADOBO

INGREDIENTS

1 kg chicken (cut into serving pieces)

1/2 cup soy sauce

1/4 cup vinegar

1 cup water

6 cloves garlic (minced)

1 onion (sliced)

2 bay leaves

1 tsp black peppercorns (or ground black pepper)

1 tbsp brown sugar (optional)

2 tbsp cooking oil

1/2 tsp salt (adjust to taste)

HOW TO COOK?

1. Marinate the Chicken
In a bowl, combine the chicken, soy sauce, minced garlic, and black pepper. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for better flavor).

2. SautÃ© the Aromatics
Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

3. Simmer the Adobo
Pour in the reserved marinade, water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Add Vinegar & Adjust Seasoning
Pour in the vinegar (do not stir yet) and let it cook uncovered for about 5 minutes to remove the strong acidic taste. Stir and add brown sugar (if using) and salt to taste.

5. Reduce the Sauce & Serve
Let it simmer uncovered for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency. Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

INGREDIENTS

Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

2 bay leaves

HOW TO COOK?

2. SautÃ© the Aromatics
Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

1 onion (sliced)

1/2 tsp salt (adjust to taste)

HOW TO COOK?

1. Marinate the Chicken

2. SautÃ© the Aromatics
Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

3. Simmer the Adobo
Pour in the reserved marinade, water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Add Vinegar & Adjust Seasoning
Pour in the vinegar (do not stir yet) and let it cook uncovered for about 5 minutes to remove the strong acidic taste. Stir and add brown sugar (if using) and salt to taste.

5. Reduce the Sauce & Serve
Let it simmer uncovered for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency. Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

LUMPIANG SHANGHAI

INGREDIENTS

1 kg chicken (cut into serving pieces)

1/2 cup soy sauce

1/4 cup vinegar

1 cup water

6 cloves garlic (minced)

1 onion (sliced)

2 bay leaves

1 tsp black peppercorns (or ground black pepper)

1 tbsp brown sugar (optional)

2 tbsp cooking oil

1/2 tsp salt (adjust to taste)

HOW TO COOK?

1. Marinate the Chicken
In a bowl, combine the chicken, soy sauce, minced garlic, and black pepper. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for better flavor).

2. SautÃ© the Aromatics
Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

3. Simmer the Adobo
Pour in the reserved marinade, water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. Add Vinegar & Adjust Seasoning
Pour in the vinegar (do not stir yet) and let it cook uncovered for about 5 minutes to remove the strong acidic taste. Stir and add brown sugar (if using) and salt to taste.

5. Reduce the Sauce & Serve
Let it simmer uncovered for another 10 minutes until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency. Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy!

2. SautÃ© the Aromatics
Heat the cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. SautÃ© the onion until soft, then add the marinated chicken (reserve the marinade). Sear the chicken until slightly browned on both sides.

Pour in the reserved marinade, water, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and let it simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
